mdes.slick.sui
Class Component

java.lang.Object
  mdes.slick.sui.Component
Direct Known Subclasses:
Container
public abstract class Component
extends java.lang.Object

An abstract base component which all other components must derive from.

Since:
b.2.0

Method Detail

updateAppearance

public abstract void updateAppearance()

This method updates the appearance by retrieving it from the current skin.

This method is typically called from the constructor of a subclass. It is usually implemented in the following manner: 

public void updateAppearance() {
     setAppearance(Sui.getSkin().getXXXAppearance());
 }
Where getXXXAppearance represents the component appearance (such as getButtonAppearance).

setVisible

public void setVisible(boolean b)
Sets the visibility for this component and all of its children. Invisible components are not rendered. If a component with the focus is hidden, the focus is released.

Parameters:
b - true if it should be renderable

isShowing

public boolean isShowing()
Determines whether this component is showing on screen. This means that the component must be visible, and it must be in a container that is visible and showing.

Returns:
true if the component is showing, false otherwise
See Also:
setVisible(boolean)

protected void renderComponent(org.newdawn.slick.gui.GUIContext container,
                               org.newdawn.slick.Graphics g)
Called to render this component. By default, this method will render the current appearance if it exists and is enabled.

Parameters:
container - the GUIContext we are rendering to
g - the Graphics context we are rendering with

public void setOpaque(boolean b)
Sets whether this label is opaque. Opaque components will draw any transparent pixels with the background color.

Parameters:
b - true if background color should be drawn

isOpaque

public boolean isOpaque()
Returns whether this label is opaque. Opaque labels will fill a rectangle of the background color before drawing the text or image.

Returns:
true if background color should be drawn

updateComponent

protected void updateComponent(org.newdawn.slick.gui.GUIContext container,
                               int delta)
Called to update this component. By default, this method will render the current appearance if it exists and is enabled.

Parameters:
container - the GUIContext we are rendering to
delta - the delta time (in ms)

render

public void render(org.newdawn.slick.gui.GUIContext container,
                   org.newdawn.slick.Graphics g)
Called to render this component as a whole. For subclasses looking for custom rendering (outside of skins), it is suggested that you override renderComponent and disable the appearance.

Parameters:
container - The container displaying this component
g - The graphics context used to render to the display

update

public void update(org.newdawn.slick.gui.GUIContext container,
                   int delta)
Updates this container and its children to the screen.

The order of updating is as follows:

  1. Update this component through updateComponent
  2. Update this component's border through updateBorder
  3. Update this component's children through updateChildren

For custom updating of the component, override renderComponent.
For cusotm updating of the border, override renderBorder.
For custom updating of the children, override renderChildren.

Parameters:
container - The container displaying this component
delta - The delta to update by

setLocationRelativeTo

public boolean setLocationRelativeTo(Component c)
Centers this container relative to the specified Component. If the passed container is null, the size of the game context is used instead. To determine the context, this component must first call getDisplay() -- if that fails, the most recently cached context is used. If no context is found, the method returns false without changing the location.

Parameters:
c - the component to center with
Returns:
fale if no display was found and if this component was not moved, true otherwise

setLocationRelativeToContext

public void setLocationRelativeToContext(org.newdawn.slick.gui.GUIContext context)
Centers this component based on the size of the given context. If null is passed, no change is made.

Parameters:
context - the context to center to

public void setBounds(float x,
                      float y,
                      float width,
                      float height)
Sets the bounds of this Container.

The x and y positions are relative to this component's parent. However, if no parent exists, the x and y positions are equivalent to the absolute x and y positions.

Parameters:
x - the x position of this component
y - the y position of this component
width - the width of this component
height - the height of this component

setFocusable

public void setFocusable(boolean b)
Sets the focus ability of this component. Focusable components can receive key, controller or mouse wheel events if they have the focus. Non-focusable components will never receive key, controller or mouse wheel events.

Parameters:
b - true if this component should receive key, controller or mouse wheel events when it has the focus

isFocusable

public boolean isFocusable()

grabFocus

public void grabFocus()

hasFocus

public boolean hasFocus()

releaseFocus

public void releaseFocus()
Releases the focus on this container and all of its Window parents. If this component did not have the focus, no change is made.

If the top-level parent of this component is an instance of Window, it will be deactivated.

setGlassPane

public void setGlassPane(boolean b)
Glass pane components will ignore events and the underlying components (ie: the parent panel) will pick them up instead.

Still testing this.

Parameters:
b - whether this component should be glass pane

isConsumingEvents

protected boolean isConsumingEvents()
Can be overridden if you wish this component's mouse dragged, pressed and released events to pass down to slick.

For example, the Display does not (by default) consume events.

Returns:
true if we should consume an even on a mouse press/release of this component

                            char chr)

fireMouseEvent

protected void fireMouseEvent(int id,
                              int button,
                              int x,
                              int y,
                              int ox,
                              int oy,
                              int absx,
                              int absy)
Fires the specified mouse event to all mouse listeners in this component.

Parameters:
id - the MouseEvent id constant
button - the index of the button (starting at 0)
x - the local new x position
y - the local new y position
ox - the local old x position
oy - the local old y position
absx - the absolute x position
absy - the absolute y position
See Also:
MouseEvent

isBorderRendered

public boolean isBorderRendered()

setBorderRendered

public void setBorderRendered(boolean borderVisible)
Provides a hint for skins as to whether or not this component should display its border. The default value is true, even if the component has no border. It is up to the skin developer to choose whether or not it is worth their while to implement support for visible borders on components.

Parameters:
borderVisible - true if a border should be rendered on this component, assuming it has one defined by the current skin
